alert.note: Alert for Logan; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 19 at 10:22PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Allen, Barren, Clinton, Cumberland, Logan, Metcalfe, Monroe, Simpson and Warren. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is likely across portions of the Watch area, with localized amounts possibly exceeding 3 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
